line_1: When the two beauteous Sisters lowly knelt,
line_2: And su'd to those, who more than Pity felt.

line_1: Two matrons came! with them she humbly knelt,
line_2: Their action copied and their comforts felt,

line_1: When to his graceful harp he knelt,
line_2: Blest was the tenderness he felt

line_1: But at her feet impassioned knelt.
No mother by her bleeding offspring knelt.
line_2: Nor war nor mis'ry in its precincts dwelt,

line_1: And vainly, to move her, in agony knelt;
line_2: What though from her coldness keen anguish I felt,

line_1: Where heroes vow'd, and sigh'd, and knelt;
line_2: Nay, 'twas unlike the love she felt;

line_1: Knelt at the shrine where thou hast knelt;
line_2: Have I not known the pangs thou'st felt;

line_1: And "bent the knee where I have knelt."
line_2: No more, since thou hast sorrow felt,
